page.title: 17Housing in Kelso
page.content: Housing in Kelso is a mixture of { {privately owned, District Council {owned,}and{Scottish Special Housing {Association}property. The population of Kelso is at present{5600.}Council house tenants are able, at present, to buy their property and so far{19%}of them have done so. The{average price} is{Â£18500}with a discount, making the{ {final average cost}around{Â£10000 - {Â£12000.}The{weekly rent}presently paid for a Roxburgh District Council, four apartment house is{Â£22.89: Â£16.28 rent {and Â£6.61 rates. 5%}of the properties have garages attached and{13%}have lock-up garages.{38%}of the housing is made up of{flats.}The vast mojority of Kelso's houses are privately owned and the most recent developments are{ {Sydenham Court, Cheviot Court}and{ {Tweedside Park. }
